definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: So the Levites made preparations for themselves and for the Aaronic priests.
sentences.chinese: 所以利未人爲自己和祭司亞倫的子孫，預備祭物。

sentences.english: And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 你們將瞎眼的獻爲祭物，這不爲惡嗎。

sentences.english: Why do you scorn my sacrifice and offering that I prescribed for my dwelling?
sentences.chinese: 我所吩咐獻在我居所的祭物，你們爲何踐踏。

sentences.english: The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable- how much more so when brought with evil intent!
sentences.chinese: 惡人的祭物是可憎的，何況他存惡意來獻呢。

sentences.english: The multitude of your sacrifices- what are they to me?' says the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 耶和華說，你們所獻的許多祭物，與我何益呢？

sentences.english: When you bring blind animals for sacrifice, is that not wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你們將瞎眼的獻爲祭物，這不爲惡麼。

sentences.english: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
sentences.chinese: 惡人的祭物是可憎的，何況他存惡意來獻呢。

definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
